comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: A report on Harvard sports a little later than this has reports on football at books.google.com/books?id=YluWJIchpVEC&pg=PA76&lp... Of the footballers pictured in this batch of Bain photos, I see: H. R. Hitchcock, Jr. '14 W. H. Trumbull, Jr. '15 D. C. Parmenter '13 P. L. Wendell '13 R. T. P. Storer '14 F. J. O'Brien '14 G. A. McKinlock Jr. '16 For Coolidge there are two possibilities: T. J. Coolidge, 3rd '15 C. A. Coolidge '17

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: If this is T.J. Coolidge III, he is the great-great-great-grandson of Thomas Jefferson, according to www.masshist.org/findingaids/doc.cfm?fa=fa0031 Obituary in NYT for Thomas Jefferson Coolidge at select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F6091FFB3D551B7B... [subscription required] has a picture that could be this guy. And NYT report on a November 1913 game suggests that it is probably him, since CA Coolidge doesn't get a mention query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E01E1D71E3BE633A...

comment.author: 33713769@N02
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called blowupnewyork, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content: swanq: Thanks! I think it's somewhat inconclusive which Coolidge this might be, as both C.A. Coolidge and T.J. Coolidge are mentioned as playing in a November 1914 game in this article from the New York Times. There is a photo in the article, but it's hard to say if it's the Coolidge pictured here, particularly if these two Coolidges happen to be brothers and share similar features. We will add a bit more to this description, since it doesn't mention Harvard or football, but may leave the identity a bit vague for now. Thanks for the sleuthing!
